flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
I will teach anyone interested enough how to automate 12VDC and 120VAC relays which in turn flip 12VDC motors and 120VAC valves based on analog temperature readings and time. I have incorporated these relays, valves,and motors on a Still at my place of work.

This Still required constant attention from me until I installed the Arduino, relays, valves, and motors. Now it requires me to flip a switch and walk away from it unattended for the complete distillation of 5 or 6 hours.

guide.summary: I work at Nashville Tennessee's first distillery and have equipped a 1920's Still with an Arduino that controls steam(heat) and water(for the condenser) based on two temperature readings and using the millis() function provided from the Arduino team.
guide.title: Arduino Automated Still for producing alcohol
